Key Match Events: Kings went on a 17-2 run to end the third quarter and take an 83-77 lead
Sacramento started the fourth on an 11-4 run, extending the lead to double digits on a 3-pointer by Trey Lyles
Trailing by nine in the third quarter, the Kings turned around what had been a listless performance
Pre-Game Insights: The Kings were without a win in six games, and the Mavericks were without their top three scorers
Post-Match Reflections: Sacramento snapped a six-game losing streak, fending off an 18-point, first-quarter deficit and early boos from the home crowd for a desperately needed win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks were without Kyrie Irving (shoulder), Klay Thompson (illness), Dereck Lively II (hip) and Naji Marshall (suspension), in addition to Luka Doncic being out for at least the next month with a calf strain
Spencer Dinwiddie and PJ Washington both had season highs for the Mavericks
Others: Doug Christie won his first game as the interim head coach of the Kings
